website_summaries.verdict: Whether you need an outdoor shoe for walking or exploring, the Presidio has the most to offer without being too bulky – the style, comfort, and build for active lifestyles.
pros: A sporty, rugged pair that most wearers find comfortable thanks to the supportive build and interior cushioning
Waterproof nubuck leather and "grippy" rubber soles make them ideal for lengthy outdoor wear or extensive walking
cons: Some women found that they run a bit snug, while others claim that they fit wide feet best
Not suited for extremely rough terrain, but fit most wearers' needs

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  This Presidio shoe has really changed!
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing Keen Presidio shoes for nearly a decade and I have always been able to wear them comfortably right out of the box. This latest purchase was a major disappointment. I couldn't even get the shoe on my foot. I loosened the laces and I still couldn't get it on. The shoe seems more narrow and shorter. I checked the box and my order to make sure I hadn't ordered the wrong size. Nope. It was the exact same shoe I have always ordered in the past. I am not sure why Keen changed this shoe. I have returned the shoes and will now start a search for a new comfortable shoe. Again, what a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Terese Francis

customer_reviews.title: Redesign is terrible. Not the same shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I have previously purchased 2 pairs of these shoes and loved them, so when they started to wear out again, I reordered from the exact same vendor. These are not the same shoes. Smaller toe box, rubber toe protection does not go all the way around anymore, the material feels like crap, and it’s not even the same shape. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: These are a bit different than the presidio clogs I have had before but they fit great just the same. I took out the insoles right away and put mine in. I have flat feet and wear insoles. The only down side I find is that like others before me have mentioned, the tongue is a bit long. It does not seem to bother me but I can see how someone would be irritated by it. I will buy these again in a different color as this is the first time I have bought them online.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Merkel

customer_reviews.title: Works with a bunion
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few pairs of shoes to try just before a 2-week trip that would require a lot of walking. This (Presidio) is the only pair that accommodated my bunion -- and it also accommodated my custom orthotic insert. (I find it comfortable on the foot that does not have a bunion, as well; it's not too loose.) I find the included insert to have more arch support than most shoes, even without the custom orthotic. I wore these shoes almost daily for two weeks with a variety of terrain -- sidewalk, cobblestones, rocky trails, and dirt roads. Kept up like a champ, and I was comfortable. Would love in another color or two.
customer_reviews.author: BlinkBlankBlunk

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy shoe perfect for winter wear and/or hiking
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made shoe, but be forewarned.... there's no way I could wear them in the spring or summer. The design is clunky in appearance and heavy weight (more boot-like imo), but if you're looking for a great winter and/or hiking shoe that can withstand the elements (with deep tread soles for traction) you won't be disappointed. Based on reviews, I ordered a 1/2 size up and am glad I did. IF you have wide feet, you'll appreciate the bit of extra length with plenty of room in the toe area. I can wear thick socks comfortably and my custom Orthotic insoles (for those who need/use them) also fit perfectly! Hope this review was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: crafty girl

customer_reviews.title: Pass on these......
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are at least one size too small. I have 5 other pair of Keen shoes, two of them this exact model, and these are the only ones too small. They are NOT what they used to be in terms of quality....very cheap materials now...yet the price is still up there. Pass on these folks.
customer_reviews.author: Ponydriver

customer_reviews.title: Bad Choice
customer_reviews.text: Anticipating a trip to Europe and living everything about my first pair of Presidios I ordered this shoe without looking at the reviews. This new version is nothing like the original. These shoes were stiff, poorly made, hard to adjust the laces and not in the least the quality product I’ve grown to trust from Keen. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Linn

customer_reviews.title: Keens have compromised quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same shoe six years ago --when the description accurately named leather uppers and footbed. The shoes I received today (the old Keen's finally wore out) have leather sides but the top looks and feels suspiciously like vinyl (I have my old pair to compare them with) and the footbed is mesh, definitely not leather. The quality no longer merits the price tag. These new Keens are going back, and they have lost a customer.
customer_reviews.author: garden girl

customer_reviews.title: Great for the medical field
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I’m on my feet about 8 hours a day minimum (medical job). I wore my last pair into the ground before buying a new pair. I wear these 4-5 a week and they lasted about 18 months for me. These are the best shoes I’ve found that doesn’t hurt my heels and knees after a long day
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Olive Oyl...move over.
customer_reviews.text: My narrow foot feels very secure in this shoe. It has great arch support and a roomy toebox. The spacious toebox results in a clog-like look to the shoe...maybe not the best look for my thin ankles and legs. The shoe is attractive, comfortable and appears to be well constructed, so I am going to work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ido1der

customer_reviews.title: Good quality shoe
customer_reviews.text: I am currently dealing with Plantar Fasciitis and needed a shoe that could fit my orthotics. In addition, I've been looking for a good waterproof walking shoe for a trip to Europe next year. This shoe seems to fit the bill. I have worn them to work for about a week and they are breaking in nicely. I like that there is room in the tow box so no rubbing there. I find them to be very comfortable. I have not done extensive walking in them yet. I will say they got a vote of approval from the Podiatrist as a good supportive shoe with the previously mentioned orthotic I added.
customer_reviews.author: MCW- TX

customer_reviews.title: Interior lining does not hold up to use (choose something with leather interior)
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable..BUT.. The fabric lining at the heel wore out in 1.5 month, and after 2.5 mo of use, white filling sticks out large hole where back cushion used to be, and the interior fell apart. This could be prevented by using leather lining at the heel, but Keen didnt so.. They are going to the trash.. Also, do not fit low, i had to usesports inserts to raise the sides above my ankles so thatthey would not rub and cause blisters as happened on 1st days, before resorting to extra insoles. Length is fine 7.5 fits as 7.5-8
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I'm looking for
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a really comfortable waterproof (these are just water-resistant) shoe for traveling. These seemed well-made, and are nice looking if you're not wanting the sneaker look (i didn't think they looked right with shorts or leggings/yoga pants, but good with pants or jeans). I liked the wider toe box. They didn't feel especially cushioned or like they had a lot of arch support, and were a little stiff around the ankles. The ankles are cut low; my no-show socks still showed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love Keen shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love Keen shoes! I've worn them for about 15 years. The last two pairs I owned lasted for over 8 years. They were coming apart at the seems which seems reasonable for that amount of time. That's why I finally ordered another pair. I love these shoes. They fit as expected. I am always anxious about ordering shoes on line, but I just used my size on the old Keen shoes. It was a perfect fit! I will definitely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needed some breaking-in but perfect now
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes 2 weeks before vacation and when they arrived i thought i would need a plan B - they felt pretty rigid and not super comfortable. But after wearing them for a week (I walk a lot) they stretched and adjusted to my feet shape and are quite comfortable now. We walked a lot on our Italy vacation - pavement, cobblestone, dirt, gravel, stairs, marble, wilderness, more stairs - 20km/day on average - and shoes held well and didn't cause and discomfort, provided good grip and support on many surfaces. I'm quite happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Katya A

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: These shoes feel like they must be fakes. The first pair of Keens that I bought 10 years ago fit perfectly & I felt that my feet were comfortable & protected in all kinds of weather walking in an urban environment. I replaced my original pair after several years of non stop use. The first replacement fit like my original pair. This latest purchase doesn’t look or feel like my previous pairs, the toe box is smaller & my toes were crushed after a 1hr hike in my neighborhood
customer_reviews.author: M. Eldin

customer_reviews.title: Terrific walking shoes with lots of toe room
customer_reviews.text: These walking shoes, Presidio by Keen, are my favorite. They are great for long walks with the ample space for toes to move around, keeping my feet from overheating. The support is just right, though I add orthotics and order a half size up for them. One can feel pretty protected with the firm toe guard - kicking a rock will do little harm! Love these shoes and hope they never stop making this style. Yes, they look clunky, it's part of the package :) We need MORE colors. Also, the Presidio II do NOT give the toe space and haven't worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: CaliCoastBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Not Keen Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Keen shoes for 20 years. I must have a dozen pair. These are the worst Keens ever. They are stiff and not as roomy with zero support. Still the same high price though. I read the reviews which indicated this but I thought maybe people were being too particular. Not. Don’t buy. They feel like a Chinese knock off.
customer_reviews.author: SJD

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and provide great support
customer_reviews.text: I just received the Keen Presidio Oxford, and so I am writing this review after having worn the shoes just 3 full work days. The shoe is large and kind of stiff, but I purchased it to have more arch support and I think it serves that purpose. I would rather have a "cuter" shoe, but this solid black oxford is not too bad looking, just a bit clunky because it gives you such a large toe box. The shoes were comfortable from the first day that I wore them, and they seemed to help reduce my plantar fasciitis pain. So, the shoes are comfortable and have great support -- how much more can you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Short
customer_reviews.text: They're very attractive and appear to be comfortable, but these shoes are too short. I can't get my heel into the back of the shoe, even though the toe box is a perfect fit. The photo shows them between my size 9 Merrells, which run a half size small. My Ariats are 8.5 (US).
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Sorrell

customer_reviews.title: Work well and looked great when traveling.
customer_reviews.text: Have trouble with feet when traveling, but I wore these shoes almost daily through Europe and was impressed. Walked 7-10 miles in them most days. I did break them in a bit ahead of time, but had absolutely no issues with them. I wear a 7.5 and although the toe box seemed too wide, they worked! I bought the ones that were not waterproofed from the factory and did that myself, saving about $40.
customer_reviews.author: L from Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: KEEN - WAKE UP BEFORE IT IS TOO LATE!!
customer_reviews.text: These are not the quality or comfort of my old beloved Keens. Fire the bugger who changed the shoe as you will lose your customer base. Sears dropped quality for the big bucks and look at them now! Perhaps you should make the old style and send each of us a pair to re-establish your good name! Otherwise, you've lost a lot of customers forever, including me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe !
customer_reviews.text: This is by far one of the best shows I’ve owned. I have plantar fasciitis, gout and Arthritis in my foot. I bought these for 3 reasons : 1– removable insert so I can use my orthotics 2-solid color with sold black insole - wear dress Slacks for work and have note from doctor to Wear tennis shoes but still wanted something That didn’t stand out so much 3- I have a thin foot but a wider toe box and my Feet swell BUT a wide shoe is too wide. These are perfect I’ve worn them for 3 years but now I’m worried as some reviews say the make of the shoe has changed
customer_reviews.author: The Griswolds

customer_reviews.title: Works for me, but may not work for all folks.
customer_reviews.text: I have little or no padding on the bottom of my feet; so I need this thick and stiff sole. Most people will say the shoe is too stiff all over. Yes, the leather of the shoe body is also stiff. But I need the support of the body of the shoe and the stiff and very thick sole. Not flexible, but works for me. This type Keen does NOT work for my husband, who wants a light and flexible shoe. This is not a light shoe. You know you have a shoe on. But it works for me with my feet with no padding on bottom.
customer_reviews.author: gpdooby

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is off compared to previously purchased Presidios
customer_reviews.text: I love Keens. I have worn out several pair. I have a duck foot: narrow heel, wide forefoot with toes that go straight across instead of angling down. These were to be a replacement pair for my work shoes (I'm a nurse on my feet all day - Keens plus SuperFeet insoles are my go-to.) I ordered the same size that I currently wear. I was hugely disappointed when they arrived - as they were huge! Keen, since when is a US 7 = an Euro 39? My feet love your shoes, but please please please standardize your sizes - without making the toe box narrower like you did with the Targhee.
customer_reviews.author: Mirabella

customer_reviews.title: Not matching at the front
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit great. Then I noticed that at the front of the shoe the rubber parts were different sizes. I needed the shoes for a trip so I didn't have time to return them. Hopefully no one notices this difference like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Maria B. Benzon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy shoes to replace all the "cute flats" that don't last
customer_reviews.text: I love my Keen hiking boots so it's no surprise I love these too. I'm tired of repeatedly paying for expensive, poorly made, "cute flats" for work that wear out way too quickly. These still look good and if they're made with the same quality as my other Keens - I know will hold up for many miles. They're also solid enough for me to wear out to some project sites for work in lieu of boots. Totally satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: L.R.

customer_reviews.title: I like my Keens but the new pair isn't the same!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these shoes I purchased. They are totally different! Both size 9's, but the new pair is bigger. Lengthwise. One of the things I like about my old pair is the smooth insert...my foot slides right in. The new pair doesn't have this. It has a textured material that you feel the whole time you wear them. I like the new pair ok...and maybe once they get broke in, they will be better.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, hardworking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these for admit a well and LOVE them. Working in food service, I spend most of the day on my feet, so I asked around and a coworker recommended Keens. Other reviews of this shoe said they were sized small, so I ordered up a half size and have them a try. The first day, I was expecting to have my feet ache from "breaking then in," but I wore them comfortably the entire eight hours on my feet. They're supportive, comfortable, and even a bit cute. I highly recommend them (though so order up a half size), and I would buy them again. Totally worth the $110 I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Emmyschue

customer_reviews.title: High quality shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t usually buy shoes online. I have picky feet; let’s leave it at that and it’s hard to find decent shoes in a size 11 for women! I needed waterproof shoes for my walks with our dogs here in the Oregon rain and couldn’t find anything other than rain boots in stores. I’m so glad I ordered these shoes. They’re definitely waterproof and fit great. They’re a little wider in the front and that’s exactly what I needed. They feel firm but are comfortable. IMO they are worth the price and I would buy them again. The quality is great and I believe they will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: KayVe

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, low quality
customer_reviews.text: I love them, they are roomie at the time which is what I've been looking for. However, the seem is becoming unglued after just two weeks of use. I really hoped to have found the perfect shoe for me (nurse with flat feet) but I paid good money for shoes that might last me just 4 weeks. I'm thinking of returning them 😪😪
customer_reviews.author: Karen Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a trip because of their wide toe box and because my friend likes hers. I haven't even broken them in yet, but they seem comfortable and roomy. They're more light weight than my usual trekkers, so for that reason they seem a little less substantial, but I think they're going to work fine -- and I needed solid black, which the other company doesn't make. If there were a 1/2 star, I'd give these 4 1/2.
customer_reviews.author: Karen H

customer_reviews.title: Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a HUGE fan of both Amazon and KEEN Shoes for many years and have always been pleased with my purchases. However, these shoes are not like my original Keen Presidio shoes. The originals are real leather. Split leather outer and smooth leather interior. Even the insoles are leather, very comfortable and supportive. The new shoes I just received are a VERY poor imitation. They feel like plastic and have fabric interiors and insoles. How can you justify charging the price you do for an inferior product? I feel like I have been duped and I'm extremely unhappy with them. I will be returning them. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Norma L McBrayer

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: First off, I am a devote Chacos sandals woman. I wear them 11 months out of the year to hike 8-12 miles a day. Even in Austin, we have cold enough weather that one needs closed up shoes on occasion. I have tried so many brands, only to have my feet blistered and bleeding. I got these thinking that if they did not work out for hiking then I could wear them with casual outfits. To my surprise, they are great hiking shoes. Not one blister or even sore spots. I will be buying a backup pair!
customer_reviews.author: Rindy Fox

customer_reviews.title: Finally A perfect pair of shoes
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had bunion surgery I have flat feel I have the hardest time find cute shoes with a wide enough toe box. I wear orthotics is all of my shoes except these. I don’t need them. There was zero break in time I liked them so much I purchased another pair. Would recommend to anyone with wider feet in need of a supportive shoe
customer_reviews.author: Akitamom

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of this shoe. I bought the brown ones and love them so much I wanted the Blueberry -- all I need is purple! They are very comfortable and I can walk in them almost the entire day. I've had both knees replaced and get tired of walking pretty easily but these will help with that issue. Love the color.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Hammock

customer_reviews.title: Fit
customer_reviews.text: I own a pair of these shoes, that I bought two years ago, but at REI, those shoes were great from the start of wearing them, this new pair feel tighter and the tongue is a little bothersome to the top of my foot. I believe I will get used to this pair, but the pair from two years ago were great from the very start, time will tell!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Cook

customer_reviews.title: So comfy!
customer_reviews.text: These were great for my plantar fasciitis, and torn plantar plate...walked all over the UK in them with no foot pain!!
customer_reviews.author: andrea stowers

customer_reviews.title: Smells weird, but good shoe for high arch.
customer_reviews.text: I like that keen have a wide shoe. It helps with my high arch. I will say that when I bought them from Amazon they had a very chemically smell. After wearing them all day my feet stink. I don't know if this will go away. I did not have this problem when I bought them from REI. They are pretty comfortable. There is this weird stitching on the inside liner by my toes I can feel. It's more of a distraction not a discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Stein

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, “chunky” looking
customer_reviews.text: This shoe runs a little bit small. I returned them due to size, but won’t be re-ordering because the shoes looked too “chunky” for me. I’m looking for a nice looking walking shoe for traveling — one that is stylish and doesn’t look like a tennis shoe. This one doesn’t look like a tennis shoe, but looks just a bit too functional to be attractive. The search goes on!
customer_reviews.author: sbpoll

customer_reviews.title: and more like the old presidios used to fit
customer_reviews.text: These purple shoes have a little more room than the other new models....and more like the old presidios used to fit. In the past I have worn an 8 1/2 in the Presidio but have gone to a half size bigger because they seem to be making them a bit smaller. So I got this in a 9 and they fit perfect with a really nice wide toe box. The color is simply lovely. I wear them riding my bikes with of course...purple shirts and it looks really nice and is so much fun to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love them:)
customer_reviews.text: I love my Keens! They are super comfortable and always look amazing:). This is my second pair-- the first pair I bought before leaving on a 13-month trip around the world, and wore them almost every day. They are great for daily excursions, and hold up to a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent!
customer_reviews.text: I wear these to work in the office now because walking around with crappy shoes that cause plantars fasciitis is not worth it. My pain is finally starting to subside since I've been wearing these for a week now. I bought the solid black and wear a size 11. They have lots of room in the toe box and can tie them how I need to support my foot and ankle. I will buy these again when these wear out which will probably be quite a while. This is a well made shoe.
customer_reviews.author: grace

customer_reviews.title: Not wide in the toes
customer_reviews.text: Very frustrating that the only company that makes shoes with TRULY WIDE toe boxes cannot make an oxford for the loyal customers who've been wearing their boots for years. People with wide, square toe boxes have almost no shoe choices. If Keen would make shoes that fit me other than the heavy boots, I'd be buying them! I do have the Kaci Winter clog and it's WONDERFUL. Unfortunately, the Kaci regular slip on is very rough and uncomfortable. So I am stuck wearing boots, even in the hot summer. I would LOVE a pair of sneakers or oxfords that really had room for my toes and looked nice at work.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than regular keen shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my “keen” size and these are definitely not even close! I compared them to another pair of keens I have and they are at least a full size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: MommaD

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe with protection from cold
customer_reviews.text: 4 years ago I purchased a pair of these shoes and I loved them, wore them during the fall, winter and early spring. The reason I like them so much is because the upper part is not mesh, therefore your foot doesn't freeze during the cooler days. I purchased these again as my old pair was truly looking it's age even though I will continue to wear them. I gave 4 stars because the material they are made from has changed and is just a bit stiffer. I hope they break-in soon, but I still like them and wear them daily.
customer_reviews.author: Linda C

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these shoes! (Buy them a full size larger)
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly “IF” you order at least one size larger. I usually buy 1/3 size larger for Keen sandals but for this shoe I had to order a full size larger. I where these for 12-16 hr shifts on my feet and my feet feel great. Used them as my only shoe on a 10 day walking tour in Norway. We were allowed only a carry on luggage. Dressed up nicely with black sacks. No regrets at all! I will buy another pair so that if they stop making them I have another pair.
customer_reviews.author: H Tork

customer_reviews.title: Different construction
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this particular shoe for around 7 years and have purchased 5 pairs. This pair is so different in construction and materials that I don’t think I’ll ever buy another. The leather is very stiff and where they used to have fabric backing it’s now all leather.
customer_reviews.author: Cleo Hamant

customer_reviews.title: WHEW!
customer_reviews.text: I wasa little worried when I read some of the reviews stating that the newer shoe isn't what is used to be and I could tell. The tongue felt stiffer to the touch and the shoe laces were coated. I also thought my middle toe eas touching but now that I've worn them all day on my feet standing, I still feel the roomy toe box and the good support in my instep. Without these shoes I will limp and have worse throbbing in my feet at night from my degenerative arthritis in my feet as well as a fracture from last year. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing - cheap & uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have many KEEN shoes that I have purchased locally. This is the first time I purchased online. I have been wearing this model for 2 years and love them. However, I am very disappointed with this purchase and plan to return. This version looks cheap and feels cheap & stiff too. The shoe laces are stiff and feel like they will not last long. There is glue visible on the shoes and scuff marks – like someone already wore them! I don’t know if this is true for all KEEN shoes, but I’ll buy locally and pay more for quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my Keen's Presidio. I have been looking for a new everyday shoe since my go-to Asics seem to have changed for the worse. I have a severe overpronation in one ankle and need a lot of support. I replaced the insole with Pinnacle Maxx and have been very pleased. It is also nice to have something that isn't a tennis shoe in the everyday rotation, but I wouldn't wear these to work. They are a little too casual. I ordered the brown and plan to order another pair soon.
customer_reviews.author: R504

customer_reviews.title: Staining shoes
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes, but they have one big problem. There is something black on the inside of one shoe that stains every sock I put on. This seems ridiculous but there you go...every single left sock I own is now tattooed with black all over the top after wearing these. Seems like for the money I paid this shouldn’t be a problem!
customer_reviews.author: G. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for walking and standing on concrete
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Keen Presidio/presidio II - I Really love them. I have purchased all sorts of work shoes but never considered Keen. After my co worker told me about them, I took the plunge. Very well worth it. I have very high arches and my feet bother me greatly. Love the wide toe box and the break in period is minimal. Very comfortable and practical for working on concrete floors. I also wear them for casual wear. Not the prettiest shoe, but practical and comfortable. Like the presidio II the best - but I will buy either.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Comfy Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these shoes. I severely sprained my ankle over the summer and have been having issues with it since. I am on my feet a lot for work and found myself limping in pain at the end of the day with other shoes. My doctor recommended I try a pair of Keens and I'm glad I did. While my ankle still feels sore at the end of the day, I am able to keep walking. The shoes are sturdy and supportive and have a removable insert so you can add your own arch support if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Phill2d

customer_reviews.title: unwearable shoes
customer_reviews.text: These black Keens are unwearable. I've tried and tried. The sole is like a board. The arch support pushes into my foot. The sides are stiff and unyielding. Even the shoe laces are rigid. They hurt my feet! I've worn Keens for years. They are my shoe of choice for walking. But not this pair. What has happened to the Keen quality?
customer_reviews.author: Carol B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I wear between size 7-8 depending on the shoe. I have thin feet. I bought a size 7. 1/2 and it is a perfect fit. I’ve bought keen shoes before and had to size down but these were perfect. They were really stiff at first but starting to loosen up. They are really nice! Good quality. I walk a lot at work and my second is job on my feet all night and these shoes were so comfortable. I was worried they would hurt my feet till broken in but great comfort from the gate!
customer_reviews.author: DENNISE PRYOR

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Received these yesterday and while I have not worn these outside, i did wear them around the house for hours and these are great! I like that they always have a roomy toe box as I always wear socks, and I order a 1/2 size up with this in mind. This is my third pair in different colors and another pair is coming in a few days!!
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Black Leather Work Shoes Fit the Bill
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pair of comfortable black leather work shoes and had trouble finding something that I liked at a reasonable price at the local stores. I spotted this Keen shoe and thought that it would be good for work. I've owned the shoe for many months now. I can comfortably stand and walk in them all day. My feet feel very comfortable due to the wider toe area. I think that I've found my new favorite work shoe. :) The fit is as I expected. I usually wear an 8.5 and this shoe was perfect for me, even though it is listed as an M instead of a W.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Van Camp

customer_reviews.title: I like the looks of these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like the looks of these shoes, but they don't have any padding on the inside where the ball of the foot rests, I had to take my inserts from my tennis shoes and put them in these shoes before I could wear them. I'll have to purchase some thicker inserts for them. My feet do get tired wearing these shoes after an hour or so, probably because of the lack of padding inside. The inside is fabric instead of leather, as stated, in the specs.
customer_reviews.author: Edna m

customer_reviews.title: KEEN Presidio not as good as KEEN Brigg
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these cause I previously had the KEEN Briggs which I loved. I tried on the 7.5, but had to buy 1/2 size larger for the width fit. They will work, but honestly not as comfortable as the Brigg shoe which is no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: A. Maes

customer_reviews.title: Loved my previous pair - but these squeak
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous pair of these shoes that I loved. They were extremely comfortable. I wore them a lot and they lasted for many years. So, I bought another pair. I was happy with them until I noticed that they squeaked when I walked on any hard floor. If I had realized this before I had worn them awhile I would have returned them. I hoped the squeak would disappear with time, but it is so annoying I can't stand to wear them. I loved my previous pair so much, I am going to try buying another pair, but if they squeak they will be returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: bekmal

customer_reviews.title: ... been looking for a pair of shoes that are nice enough to wear to work and are wide enough ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a pair of shoes that are nice enough to wear to work and are wide enough for my large bunions. I got an 8.5 wide which is the same size I wear in New Balance running shoes. These shoes have a very wide toe box and narrow heel which fits my foot perfectly. Though, the very wide toe box is definitely not an elegant look... They were super comfortable right out of the box and required no breaking in. This is my first pair of Keen shoes and I'm a huge fan. I will be looking for Keen shoes in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made in China. Your feet will hurt.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in advance of a trip to the Baltics, since it's a model I've worn comfortably before. I returned from my trip with aching feet. This pair, unlike my previous pair, was made in China. The ergonomics are completely off. It's so disappointing because I've relied on and trusted the Keen brand for years.
customer_reviews.author: mkb

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this quality purchase. These are so comfortable and have great support. I have serious issues with my feet which leaves me in pain in my feet and back so I need good shoes. I intend to use these with dress pants, while not something I’d consider as ideal, it beats pain any day.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: I love KEEN!
customer_reviews.text: They're Keens, I love them. What else can I say, I'm sold on this brand. They have a wider for box to give wiggle room to my toes! Very sturdy leather and durable cotton laces with sturdy rubber soles.
customer_reviews.author: Dad's Lake House

customer_reviews.title: Booo! KEEN has sold out! NOT the same shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This used to be very well made, supportive shoe. KEEN has changed manufacturer,and the shoe now is made of cheaper materials, the roomy toe box is no more, the rubber sole does not line up with the upper, and the profile on R and L front of shoes Do Not Match. Shame on KEEN.
customer_reviews.author: stan

customer_reviews.title: love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were right out of the box comfortable and I wore them for the first time all day walking around the city. I have troublesome feet with congenital foot deformity, and hammer toes. I still tape the top of my hammer toes with moleskin, just in case they rub. they are not "cute" but I still wore them with dressier slacks and they looked fine. The sole is quite stiff, which I like. Great arch support. Did not need my orthotics. They were a bit slippery walking on (dry) tile and stone floors; perhaps due to the stiff sole. Got a great deal on these, so I have happy feet and a happy wallet!
customer_reviews.author: Natiwatt

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but orthotics don't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought another pair of These shoes many years ago and they were so comfortable and fit well. I could also wear my orthotics to give me more support. The new shoes fit well, but the design has changed somewhat at the heel and the shoe is not as deep. When wearing orthotics, my foot doesn't stay in the shoe as well as my original pair. The shoe is fits well without the orthotic and is very comfortable, but I just can't wear them as long and for long walking distances as the first pair I owned.
customer_reviews.author: Mamalight

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sporty
customer_reviews.text: I’m a loyal Keen customer, and have owned this style before. They were awesome when I was working (RN on my feet all day), and they are awesome for me now as a retiree. It’s a super cute ‘sensible’ shoe that make my feet look tiny, looks sporty and great with jeans without screaming ‘orthopedic grandma shoes.’
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Don't like the wide toe box
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these shoes. They are well made, seem comfortable, and the style looks versatile. I've never bought Keens before, though, and while I knew that the toe box is larger than other shoe brands, I was just not prepared for how that looked on my feet. My initial impression was that I was wearing clown shoes. I tried to convince myself that I was overreacting, until my husband walked in and commented, "those look big." If you're used to Keens and like the shape of the wide toe box, then these seem to be good quality shoes. If you're not used to Keens and want a slim-profile shoe, this might not meet your expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Katy K.

customer_reviews.title: Problem with length
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 8 in Keen shoes, even though that size brings my toes to the front of the box. So, this time, I ordered an 8.5 and they were still too short, so I sent those back and ordered a size 9. Now, I have less than 1/2 inch between my toe tip and the front of the shoe box. It appears the box gets wider, the higher in size you go, but the length of the interior of the shoe bed remains about the same. I will have to live with these size 9s for now.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Kay

customer_reviews.title: Keen on Keens
customer_reviews.text: These are a bit narrower than the classic presidos, and are unfortunately less durable. BUT, they are lighter and breathe better. It's a trade off, but I don't mind. This is my second pair. I really like them. Protip, soak them in vodka when you first get them for a fast custom fit! Update: I was pretty happy with this pair of shoes for about three days, and then I realized that they were not comfortable for longer stretches at all. They look and feel like my old Presidios, but there is something very strange about the footbed. Ouch!
customer_reviews.author: Rabid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the synthetics used in these new presidio.
customer_reviews.text: I like Keene and have for years, but I am disappointed in this presidio. The tongue is synthetic and too stiff. U n like the old leather tongue, I doubt it will mold to the foot. It's not as comfortable. They've retained part of the leather lining but not all. Since I walk a lot, I wear through fabric linings rapidly. I wonder if these will wear half as well as my old teens.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear on motorcycle trips as opposed to my boots. I am wearing them more than I planned. The sizing was fine. I could have gone up a half size to accommodate thicker socks. They are comfortable and I haven't had any soreness. I have an above average arch and these provide good support.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Fits differently than the Presidio used to
customer_reviews.text: I have an identical pair of Keen Presidios that are a few years old - same size, same brown color - that fit me perfectly. Unfortunately, they seem to have changed the shape of the sole slightly--the toe box is narrower and no longer fits my foot. There were some other changes too, and they generally seemed like they weren't as good quality as my old pair. I thought I might have received a counterfeit pair, so after returning them here I ordered a pair directly from the Keen website, and those had the same issue. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable roomy shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have problems with both my feet, especially after surgery to my right foot and ankle 7 months ago. Being a letter carrier means many hours both standing and walking for the last 35 years, hence the bad feet. It is very difficult to find shoes that are comfortable and enable me to walk for awhile. I have several pairs of Keens, boots and shoes. They are the only shoes that I can wear comfortably out of the box! Having room in the toe box is important for my ingrown toenails!
customer_reviews.author: M. Magallan

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe/great price
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is made extremely well and at a great price. The only thing I don’t like about them is that they are a VERY stiff shoe, I just wish they were a little more flexible. I have worn them every day for 2 weeks and they rub the tops of my toes slightly, but the insoles are the perfect arch support. I own a pair of shoes that have a slightly roomier toe box but these are ok and overall I like them.
customer_reviews.author: G.M.W.

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY shoe I will wear to work!! These are the BEST!!!
customer_reviews.text: Keen Presido's helped my feet recover from Plantar Fasciitis several years ago. I work in a hospital and am on my feet for at least 10 hours a day. These shoes are amazing!! I have purchased 8 pair over the years. They are consistently a great fit. I love the arch support and the toe bed gives my toes the room they need! They also hold up well and look like new even after wearing them for several months! Amazon provided my latest replacement Presidios and I received them quickly and in perfect shape! I highly recommend this shoe and Amazon as a service provider!!
customer_reviews.author: HappyAmazon59

customer_reviews.title: Not fashionable, but very sturdy and feet feel supported beautifully.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a very large foot you might not be pleased to wear except as a walking shoe and that would still be worth the price, which happened to be on sale. Well built, thick, supportive. They look very cute for more than walking if you have a small foot size 6 or less.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Not the same....
customer_reviews.text: It's not that I really expected the shoe to be the same years later, but I had some hope. This style runs smaller than it used to, and the toe protection section has been sheared back to not cover as much of the shoe. One reason I believe it feels tighter across that area. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, color not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a pair of Presidios that I’ve had for 5 years and still wear every day. I returned them because the color was not what I expected. I suppose since they’re called blueberry I shouldn’t have been surprised. Online they look dark gray with purple laces, but they are really VERY dark, almost black, with a dark purple hue. I’ll keep wearing my old sage colored shoes and hope Keen comes out with a new color next season. Love the shoe!
customer_reviews.author: akm

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable shoe ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I had heal pain for over two years....when I purchased my 1st pair of Keen Presidio I was able to walk without a limp or pain within the first few days. This is my 3rd pair...I can now wear other types of shoes but always have these for days when I will be on my feet for extended periods. They are my go to shoe and love that I can have many colors to have in my shoe rotations!
customer_reviews.author: Netty

customer_reviews.title: A Black Pair and a Brown One Too
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes, my first one is in black. Excellent arch support. When my arches hurt from other shoes or too much time on my feet I put these on and let the healing begin. I have very high arches and instep, these feel so good.A
customer_reviews.author: Edsmom 1

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Keens Oxfords and I am a happy customer. Each pair has lasted me 6 to 9 months and been comfortable with plenty of arch support. They hold up well to wear and tear, but I recommend water-proofing them since they are real leather. I can wear these for 8 hours straight at work with a floor that has no padding underneath the carpet. These are a must-buy for anyone looking for a a dressier shoe that can work for work as well as a casual shoe.
customer_reviews.author: book geek

customer_reviews.title: and before my Keens I would lay awake with terrible foot pain
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have changed my work life!! As a barista, I am on my feet 8+ hours a day at work, and before my Keens I would lay awake with terrible foot pain. These shoes have helped my feet and my back. I've had them a few months and they are holding up well! They had 0 break in time which was ideal for my busy life! Several of my friends in the same field have bought pairs after seeing the pep in my step these last couple months. LOVE THESE SHOES! They are true to size with a nice wide toe for extra comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hare

customer_reviews.title: SO comfortable !
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a trip to Ireland. Walked miles every day in these shoes, rain and shine. SO comfortable ! My feet stayed dry and happy. I have a high arch and usually find that my feet hurt in any shoe other than Birkenstocks, so I was delighted when these fit so well. I love these and plan on getting another pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: deborahp46

customer_reviews.title: Such comfortable shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I just got these and wore them for the first time to work all day - on my feet a lot - and they are so comfortable. I didn't even need a breaking in period. I usually wear Merrells but was looking for something different and like Merrells they are awesome. I usually wear a 6.5 with Merrells and a 6.5 with Keen is a little big but I was worried the 6 might be too small so kept them and they're fine a little big. No slipping or rubbing my heel.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but too small
customer_reviews.text: The size 12 was too big and the size 11 way to small-short. I returned the larger size 12, but should have returned the size 11 as well. My feet are so jammed to the front of the shoe that is causes a great deal of pain after one hour or less of having them on. Causes problems with toenails too. I wish Keen made their shoes in half sizes. They are a nice shoe. But I am out $120 for thinking I could "make" them work. Don't make the same mistake.
customer_reviews.author: YL

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy them
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! The quality of the shoe has gone downhill. They have decreased the amount of leather. The insoles are cheap. I have been wearing this style for 10 years. I sent these back. Will have to look else where for a casual fall/winter shoe. So SAD.
customer_reviews.author: JAB

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for walking in wet weather. I have some difficulties due to knee replacement but these are great. I can be on my feet all day. I can even add a small orthotic. These shoes look small and compact instead of clunky. Almost like a child's shoe but with sophistication. I like them and would buy another pair if I needed one. The quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: I have had several pairs of these Keen shoes. I wear them to work every day in the cooler/colder months. I have a brown pair and a black pair at all times. I have found that they are even my go to shoes for the weekends. I use to wear tennis shoes on the weekends. But these shoes are so comfortable I tend to wear them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are by far some of the least comfortable, stiff shoes I've ever purchased. I was looking for good non-slip comfy work shoes for bar industry and read a lot of good things about these. I also really like Keen sandals and think they are very comfortable. BUT these are just horrible. They are so rigid it made making fast pivots and turning corners feel awkward. They run a little small, I even exchanged for a larger size in the hopes they would be more tolerable, but no go. Do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Meghan

customer_reviews.title: The only work shoe I buy
customer_reviews.text: I have terrible feet. Extremely wide toes, high arches, plantar fasciitis and a broken right ankle. I have worked in retail for most of my life and after I had broken my ankle these shoes were the only ones I could wear comfortably for an 8+ hour shift and not be limping by the end. If you have foot problems like I do you will not regret this purchase. They are durable, supportive and comfortable for working long hours in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves these shoes so much that she wears them every day. Sadly, she cannot get anything other than the mundane colors of black and brown in her size unless she pays a ridiculous premium. So black it is or brown. She'd love to have red or purple but why pay $50.00 more? Makes no sense. All those gripes aside these are great shoes, especially for diabetics.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F. Harrington, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I already own a pair of these in brown and have enjoyed them for a year. So, as you can tell I was so happy with them that I bought a second pair in black and this one is water resistant. I have wide feet and find the toe box to be very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: nyansky

customer_reviews.title: Quality but too bulky
customer_reviews.text: Got these for waitressing and bartending. These are sturdy and comfortable but they are too just bulky, sort of clunky. The toe shape fans out a little and I can’t stand how they look from the top, they look great from the profile only. Also they aren’t as skid proof as I’d hoped for. There was something slippery on the kitchen floor and the shoe didn’t offer any protection. I wish I would have returned them but now they’re too worn in.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: I've spent my life looking for perfect shoes and Keens have it
customer_reviews.text: These Keen presidios are different than the same model I bought 8 years ago. The back of the shoe is lower and the top of the shoe covers a little less, HOWEVER they are still the only oxfords I can get away with at work that have a very supportive arch and wide toe box. I've spent my life looking for perfect shoes and Keens have it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Mills

customer_reviews.title: These get a slip-guarantee from this barista.
customer_reviews.text: I had pretty high expectations for these shoes. I bought them for work after the description called them "grippy" and excellent on a wide range of terrain. I typically wear skechers work force but they wear out after six months and I decided to spend the extra 50$ for something I hoped would last a year. These shoes have excellent support and I like the way they look. Unfortunately I will not be able to wear them to work because a wet floor might as well be ice. These were worse then a coworkers old pair of converse on a wet floor.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Favorite every day shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these shoes to work for months now and they are seriously comfortable. I have a sit/stand VariDesk at work so I stand for half my day and take an hour walk on my lunch break. Super comfortable. They are very spacious in the toe area (more so than my older Keens) so I can spread out and walk like crazy! :) They are comfortable enough to stand for hours too. I would totally buy another pair of these if I needed new shoes. These are standing up very well though so far.
customer_reviews.author: JeanaL2

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite shoes. I don't ever see my self liking ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair of Presidio. I ordered these shoes one size smaller than I normally wear. They are alway tight on me in the begining but because they are leather they always have some stretch to them as I continue to wear them. These are my favorite shoes. I don't ever see my self liking anything better.
customer_reviews.author: K

product_meta.title: KEEN Women's Presidio Shoe
product_meta.description:
A waterproof take on the sporty oxford, with a leather-and-mesh mix for breathability and versatility. The cushioned footbed and supportive midsole combine for heel-to-toe comfort. CARE INSTRUCTIONs: if you're wearing your KEENs daily, they won't always be scuff and dirt-free. To treat day to day wear and tear, especially on lighter color leathers, we recommend using a leather cleaner and conditioner, found at most footwear dealers and/or shoe repair shops. Tough stains can be treated with a mixture of water and a little vinegar on a damp cloth



Presidio Casual Shoe A contemporary women's update of the classic oxford, the Keen Women's Presidio Casual Shoe provides the sporty good looks of a lace-up with comfort and support your feet will appreciate. Ideal for running errands or enjoying weekend adventures, the Presidio features a durable and water-resistant nubuck leather upper in a variety of tones to complement a casual wardrobe. It also boasts a Keen Metatomical footbed for instant comfort as well as patented toe protection and breathable linings.

Features * Sporty oxford-style shoe for casual wear
 * Water-resistant nubuck leather upper
 * Lace-up front for a custom fit
 * Removable metatomical dual density EVA footbed for arch support
 * Non-marking rubber outsole

Specs * Weight: 11.99oz / 340.52g
 * Upper: Water resistant leather
 * Lining: Leather

 Sporty oxford-style shoe is great for casual wear. View larger.

 Removable metatomical dual density EVA footbed for arch support. View larger.

CLASSIC SPORTY STYLE
 The Presidio has a sporty, borrowed-from-the-boys design with feminine touches like tonal stitching accents and a low-profile silhouette. This versatile shoe gives you a break from heels and complements jeans, yoga pants, and khakis. A lace-up front with metal eyelets makes for a custom fit.

WATER-RESISTANT UPPER AND LEATHER LININGS
 This shoe is durable and easy to wear, thanks to a water-resistant nubuck leather upper that goes the distance. And to help keep feet dry and comfortable as you move through your day, the Presidio has breathable leather linings.

KEEN METATOMICAL FOOTBED FOR CONTOURED SUPPORT
 For comfort and support during every adventure, the Presidio features a removable dual-density Keen Metatomical EVA footbed that provides arch support by hugging the natural contours of your foot.

PATENTED TOE PROTECTION
 Because you never know what might cross your path, the Presidio includes Keen.Protect, patented toe protection that wraps up and over the outsole for thorough coverage of the entire toe bed.

RUBBER OUTSOLE FOR GREAT TRACTION
 Whether you're navigating city streets, hitting the shops, or enjoying outdoor adventures, you'll appreciate the Presidio's non-marking rubber outsole. It delivers a steady step on a variety of terrain and won't leave black marks on floors.

KEEN: A STORY OF HYBRID INNOVATION
 Keen began in 2003 with an inspired sandal design that combined comfort and toe protection. This radical design departure for sandals spawned the overriding Keen philosophy of hybrid innovation--striving to create new possibilities and to discover and implement original ideas.

 Keen products put an emphasis on the joys of play. At the same time, Keen believes in the value of working hard to give back to the community. To that end, the company has partnered with non-profit organizations around the world to help get youth into the outdoors, protect land for its environmental and recreational value, and to give bikes to kids in need.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
 Keen Women's Presidio Casual Shoe.



From beaches to mountains to city streets, Keen believes the outdoors is anyplace without a ceiling. Keen believes in living a HybridLife, which means being part of a greater community that is full of people who create possibilities, play in the outdoors and care for the world around them.

See more
feature_bullets: Supportive, adventurous lace-up with cushioned footbed and collar. Supportive sole. Grippy tread. Cleansport NXT for natural odor control
